item.title: Marine Scientist | Diver | Fisher
item.description: (function defer() { if (window.jQuery) { jQuery(document).ready(function(){ GetLatestReleaseInfo(); }); } else { setTimeout(function() { defer() }, 50); } })(); function GetLatestReleaseInfo() { $.getJSON('https://api.github.com/repos/gcushen/hugo-academic/tags').done(function (json) { let release = json[0]; // let downloadURL = release.zipball_url; $('#academic-release').text('Latest release ' + release.name); }); }

About me I am a Ph.D. Student and Latin American Fisheries Fellow at the Bren School of Environmental Science & Management in UC, Santa Barbara. My research combines Ecology, Oceanography, and Economy to provide pragmatic solutions that further sustainable fishery management and marine conservation. I believe today’s available technology can allow us to revolutionize the way in which we manage fisheries and do conservation. I have always felt passionate about the Ocean.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Short talks: February, 2018 - Advanced RMarkdown for the LAFF group. Santa Barbara, USA September, 2017 - Intro to RMarkdown as an eco-data-science workshop. Santa Barbara, USA Workshops: September, 2017 - A General Approach and Tool to Evaluate the Effectiveness of No-Take Marine Reserves EBM tools Webinar June, 2017 - Evaluation of Marine Reserves in Mexico (spanish) to environmental managers. Mexico City, MX July, 2015 - ReefCheck kelp forest monitoring protocol: theory and practice for fishers in El Rosario and Isla Natividad, Baja California July, 2015 - Use of Oceanographic Instruments (CTD, miniDOT, SeaBird Thermistors) to community members of El Rosario and Isla Natividad, Baja California
